TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the level of authentication for DCOM security.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel enumerates the values to use when you set the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection.ComAuthenticationLevel%2A> property.
The default is Connect.
> [!NOTE] > The ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel settings are relevant only when you use the ASP.NET process model (Internet Information Services [IIS] 5.n or compatible mode on IIS 6 only).
## Examples The following code example shows how to get the current <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection.ComAuthenticationLevel%2A> property value and then set the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection.ComAuthenticationLevel%2A> property to a new value of Call.
[!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection#21](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_40_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelSection#21](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_40_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel Call = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Specifies that DCOM authenticates the credentials of the client. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks DCOM authenticates the credentials of the client when the server receives the request at the beginning of each remote procedure call.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel Connect = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Specifies that DCOM authenticates the credentials of the client. This field is constant.

remarks.format:
## Remarks DCOM authenticates the credentials of the client only when the client establishes a relationship with the server.
This is the default value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel Default = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Specifies that DCOM determines the authentication level. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks DCOM determines the authentication level using its normal security-negotiation algorithm.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Specifies no authentication. This field is constant.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel Pkt = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Specifies that DCOM verifies that all data received is from the expected client. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The datagram transports always use Pkt authentication.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel PktIntegrity = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Specifies that DCOM authenticates and verifies the data transferred. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks DCOM verifies that none of the data transferred between the client and the server has been modified.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.Configuration.ProcessModelComAuthenticationLevel PktPrivacy = int32(6)

Docs.summary: Specifies that DCOM authenticates all previous levels and does encryption. This field is constant.

remarks.format: ## Remarks DCOM authenticates all previous levels and encrypts the argument value of each remote procedure call.
